author: Megan Ellis
title: The most (and least) demanding travellers
text:
The most (and least) demanding travellers Article By: Megan Ellis Fri, 24 Jul 2015 5:14 PM Share Credit: pixabay.com/ JESHOOTS 
Accommodation site Agoda.com has revealed which countries' travellers are the most and least demanding when it comes to hotels. 
The results were based on the website's Travel Smarts survey , which analyzed over 7 million Agoda.com hotel reviews from worldwide travellers to see which nationalities, on average, rated hotels lower or higher than the global average. 
So who are the world's most demanding travellers in this regard? 
The title goes to travellers from the United Arab Emirates, who tend to give scores that are.32 review points lower than the average. 
Japanese, Omani and Indian travellers also tend to score hotels lower than the average. 
Meanwhile, Russians are the least demanding, giving hotels review scores .56 points higher than the global average. 
Other nationalities which seem to be most easily impressed are the Egyptians, Irish and Polish.
